detailPageInfo.title: eBacMap
detailPageInfo.description: eBacMap is a leader in environmental pathogen monitoring.  They utilize a unique heat mapping system to visualize environmental testing trends.  We supported their existing application before rebuilding it to better meet their customer needs, provide a more modern solution, and make it easier for their customers to add test results and monitor trends.
detailPageInfo.details: Project scope: Design a website for an environmental pathogen management company. The project included a user management system, a billing system, specialized report building and animations, a test scheduling feature, and a test result management system. It was designed using Next.js, React, Node.js, Typescript, and React-md.

problem.headline: Before rebuilding the eBacMap application it had four main issues:
bullet_points: The application couldn’t handle large amounts of test results for viewing or uploading.
The layout and design of the application were dated and the user flow wasn’t intuitive.
Trend monitoring was limited to four report types that didn’t allow users to customize for their specific reporting criteria.
The application was so dated it was difficult to add new features to meet growing customer needs.

solution.headline: To address these challenges, we redesigned the app using the latest in UI/UX practices and the most up-to-date technical stack (including Next.js, React, Node.js, and TypeScript).  We also redesigned the report feature to allow for customizable report building, and the test result viewing and uploading features to handle large amounts of data for viewing and uploading.

bullet_points: Pathogen Trend Monitoring: The customizable report builder allows users to filter test results to track specific pathogens and/or test locations and/or test types over specific time periods (along with a variety of other customizable options). It also, allows the data to be visualized utilizing a bar graph, a line graph, a time-lapsed heat map, or even with trend rings.

Dashboard: The application dashboard now offers a variety of widget options so a user can see prominent data for their location at a glance. The widget options include condensed reports, sample scheduling highlights, audit report numbers, specific condensed report types, and more.

UI/UX: The updated user interface and user experience are not only intuitive, they’re also smooth, fast, and efficient. The app is stable and utilizes user-centric error handling so the end users receive error messages that are appropriate and next steps if the issue cannot be resolved by the end user.

Test Result Handling: The updated test result table enables a user to view from 10 to 100 results at once, and includes table sorting, filtering, and pagination. The test result upload feature allows for results to be uploaded from a .xls file, it uses dynamic field mapping, data validation, and review options. It also returns any test results that were unable to be uploaded with a stated reason, so the data can be corrected and re-uploaded.

roles.role: Developing frontend
Connecting server side rendering and API
Building a Domain Driven Design (DDD) API
Product road map creation and implementation

detailPageInfo.title: STI Labs
detailPageInfo.description: Specialized Testing is a materials testing company that’s been in business for over 30 years.  They needed help automating and modernizing their internal processes, so they could be freed up to serve their customers better, lower costs, and drive revenue.  We built a custom application that automates manual tasks like keeping track of each material testing specimen, the testing results, and even report generation.
detailPageInfo.details: Project scope: Design a website for a concrete testing business to be used as a management tool. The project included specimen pickup, tracking, testing results, reporting, and invoicing. It was designed using Next.js, React, Node.js, and MaterialUI.

problem.headline: Before building the custom STI application, the company had the following areas they needed to address to save time and money:
bullet_points: Manually tracking specimens from pickup to report generation.
The report generation process where results were manually entered into a spreadsheet.

solution.headline: To address these challenges, we designed an app using Next.js, React, and Node.js.  We created a system that allowed specimens to be entered into the system for pickup or delivery, assigned to a driver to be picked up, scheduled for testing, allowed test results to be entered and stored, and then generated a report once all specimens had been tested.  The overall system automates much of the specimen pickup, testing, and report generation lifecycles ensuring customers get results in a professional and timely manner.  It also reduces the manual workload for STI and gives them more time to serve their customers.

bullet_points: Dashboard: The application dashboard shows highlights for the business including specimen pickups for today, monthly revenue to date, and report statistics. It also includes collapsed tables that can be expanded that include information about tests, pickups, specimens, and reports. All data that is available at the user’s fingertips so they can stay on top of day-to-day tasks and keep the business running smoothly.

Specimen Handling: From scheduling a pickup to recording test results the new STI application does it all. Users can easily schedule the pickup, assign it to a driver, schedule when the sample will be tested, and then record those test results all within the application. This system not only saves time but has increased revenue for STI.

Report Generation: Once all samples have been tested and their test results recorded, a report is generated that shows all the technician's findings along with the test parameters and the ASTM standards adhered to. These reports are then automatically sent to the customer email on file ensuring all completed results are available for the customer as soon as possible.

detailPageInfo.title: Moss Customer Portal
detailPageInfo.description: Moss is a place maker, they provide solutions for tension fabric structures, wide format graphics, and specialty signage to transform spaces into impactful places. They contacted us to help them connect with their customers more easily and streamline their ordering process.  With our unique web application, their customers can now get instant order updates, create new quotes, chat directly with the project manager, and make approvals on orders.
detailPageInfo.details: Project scope: My work on this project includes new feature building and bug squashing. I've worked on features for a new asset tracking option and product organization tools. The asset tracking option allows a customer to upload a floorplan for their assets and then drag-and-drop their assets onto the floorplan. This enables the customer to track their assets for maintenance and replacement. The product organization tools allow the products to be stored in catalogs for ease of finding and grouping specific products.

roles.role: Developing frontend
Connecting server side rendering and API
Bug Squashing

detailPageInfo.title: Renew Our Schools
detailPageInfo.description: Renew Our Schools is an energy education program utilized in schools across the nation to teach students and staff alike about smart energy consumption. This program required a custom web application that not only gives educators comprehensive tools to ensure they’re meeting critical learning standards for the classroom but also provides an interactive tool for students to submit their actions and track their progress.
detailPageInfo.details: Project scope: Design a website for educating children on saving energy. The project included an administration management system, a billing system, customizable competition creation, student progress tracking, and a student submission and review feature. It was designed using Next.js, React, Node.js, Typescript, and Tailwind.

roles.role: Developing frontend administration area
Connecting server side rendering and API
Building a Domain Driven Design (DDD) API

detailPageInfo.title: The Reel Hope Project
detailPageInfo.description: The Reel Hope Project creates videos for youth experiencing foster care to find a forever family.  They initially reached out to us because of site crashing issues and data vulnerability.  Once the site had been restored we developed their site on a platform that was reliable and secure and developed site improvements to allow independent edits and new page creations.
detailPageInfo.details: Project scope: Design a website for helping children in foster care find forever homes. The project included an administration management system, a page builder, and a platform for helping foster children find forever homes. It was designed using Next.js, React, Node.js, Typescript, and Tailwind.

Connecting server side rendering and API

detailPageInfo.title: SD Beer
detailPageInfo.description: SD Beer was created by the San Diego Brewers Guild to increase awareness and visibility of fresh locally brewed beer.  I contracted with Paradeigm to create a blogging feature to continue the mission of promoting awareness.  The feature included a blog post creation and editing platform for administration and a public-facing site to view the blog posts.
detailPageInfo.details: The scope of this project was to create a blog posting feature for Paradeigm LLC's customer, San Diego Brewers Guild. The blogging feature includes a blog post creation and editing platform for administration, and a public facing site for viewing the blog posts. The backend for the site, including: getting, posting, editing, and deleting endpoints, were created from scratch using NodeJS. The blog post creation and editing forms were created using Quill an open source WYSIWYG editor. The components were styled using Foundation as a grid framework.

roles.role: Developing frontend features
Connecting server side rendering and API
